com.github.tomeees.scrollpicker

Class ScrollPicker

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.LinearLayout
          • com.github.tomeees.scrollpicker.ScrollPicker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class ScrollPicker
extends android.widget.LinearLayout
    Customizable and data-bindable NumberPicker-like UI element.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Gets the selected item. Can be data-bound (2-way).
        Returns:
        If the list we set was such that its items are of String, then the returned value corresponds to the index of the selected item in the list, while in case of Integers it is the selected item's int value.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(int value)
        Sets the selected item. Can be data-bound (2-way).
        Parameters:
        value - If the list we set was such that its items are of String, then the value corresponds to the indiex of the selected item in the list, while in case of Integers it is the item's int value.

      • getSelectedItemText

        public java.lang.String getSelectedItemText()
        Gets the selected item's displayed String 'value'.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns if the view is enabled or not i.e. able to receive and process touch events.

        Note: If you disable it it will still work with data-bound changes of your view model or programmatical calls.

        Overrides:
        isEnabled in class android.view.View

      • setEnabled

        public static void setEnabled(ScrollPicker scrollPicker,
                              boolean isEnabled)
        Data binding helper method for setEnabled(boolean).

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean isEnabled)
        Should the view be enabled or not i.e. to receive and process touch events. Can be data-bound.

        Note: If you disable it it will still work with data-bound changes of your view model or programmatical calls.

        Overrides:
        setEnabled in class android.view.View

      • setTextBold

        public void setTextBold(boolean isTextBold)
        Sets if all the item texts should be bold or not.
        Parameters:
        isTextBold - Will be bold if true, not if false.

      • setSelectorColor

        public void setSelectorColor(int selectorColor)
        Sets the selector's color. The selector is the visual indication about the currently selected item at the middle of the view.
        Parameters:
        selectorColor - Standard android int representation of a color.

      • getTextSize

        public float getTextSize()
        Returns the text size of the list items displayed.

      • setTextSize

        public void setTextSize(float textSize)
        Sets the text size of the list items displayed, sets it for the selected one also if that hasn't been explicitly set.

      • setSelectedTextSize

        public void setSelectedTextSize(float selectedTextSize)
        Sets the text size of the list items displayed.

      • setList

        public void setList(android.databinding.ObservableField<java.util.ArrayList> items)
        Data binding helper method for setList(ArrayList).

      • setList

        public void setList(java.util.ArrayList items)
        Sets the list whose items this view displays. Can be data-bound. //todo
        Parameters:
        items - An ArrayList whose template type must be either String or Integer. Must be non-empty. In case of ArrayList<String> the value that you can set to this view with setValue(int) will correspond to the index of the selected item in this list, while in case of ArrayList<Integer> it will be the item's int value.

      • setShownItemCount

        public void setShownItemCount(int shownItemCount)
        Sets how many items can be shown at a time

      • setTextColor

        public void setTextColor(int textColor)
        Sets the text color of the not selected items in the list, sets it for the selected one also if that hasn't been explicitly set.
        Parameters:
        textColor - Standard android int representation of a color.

      • setSelectedTextColor

        public void setSelectedTextColor(int selectedTextColor)
        Sets the text color of the selected item.
        Parameters:
        selectedTextColor - Standard android int representation of a color.

      • addOnValueChangedListener

        public void addOnValueChangedListener(ScrollPicker.OnValueChangeListener onValueChangeListener)
        Adds a listener for the value change event, which happens when a different item gets selected with touch. This callback does not happen when the setValue is called programmatically.

      • setSelectorStyle

        public void setSelectorStyle(SelectorStyle selectorStyle)
        Sets the selector display style.

      • setSelectorLineWidth

        public void setSelectorLineWidth(float selectorLineWidth)
        Sets the selector lines' width.
        Parameters:
        selectorLineWidth - The width. Default is 4. If 0, no selector will be drawn.

      • selectNextItem

        public void selectNextItem()
        Selects the next item if the currently selected isn't the last one.

      • selectPreviousItem

        public void selectPreviousItem()
        Selects the previous item if the currently selected isn't the first one.

      • removeOnValueChangedListener

        public void removeOnValueChangedListener(ScrollPicker.OnValueChangeListener onValueChangeListener)
        Removes a listener for the value change event, which happens when a different item gets selected with touch. Wouldn't be a problem if you tried to remove one which you haven't actually added previously.
